What is Verus PBaaS Reserve technology, and how can it be used to create a fractional reserve currency on an independent blockchain with cross-chain interoperability?

Verus PBaaS Reserve technology is a powerful tool that enables any organization, regardless of size, to create a fractional reserve currency of its own on an independent, uncluttered blockchain. This technology is built on top of the Verus network and allows for cross-chain interoperability, making it immediately useful for payments and conversions to other currencies from within the Verus wallet.

One of the key benefits of Verus PBaaS Reserve technology is that it doesn't require any additional costs beyond public blockchain network fees. This means that organizations can create their own independent blockchain without incurring significant expenses.

In addition, Verus PBaaS Reserve technology allows for 100% of the 0.01% fees for conversions to go directly to the miners and stakers of the organization's new chain. This incentivizes miners and stakers to participate in the network and helps to improve the overall efficiency and profitability of the blockchain.

Miners and stakers also have the option to merge mine up to 14 other blockchains and coins while mining their own project, which can further improve efficiency, profitability, and shared liquidity for everyone involved. This is made possible by the Verus Reserve protocol, which connects each independent blockchain.

To get started with Verus PBaaS Reserve technology, organizations can launch a testnet by running the command `./verus -chain=VRSCTEST`. From there, they can define their own chain using the `definechain` command, such as in the sample chain definition provided. This definition includes parameters such as the chain's name, payment address, premine, initial contribution, conversion, and launch fee, among others.

Overall, Verus PBaaS Reserve technology provides a powerful and flexible solution for organizations looking to create their own independent blockchain with cross-chain interoperability. Its low costs, incentivized mining and staking, and merge mining capabilities make it an attractive option for organizations of all sizes.

With no costs beyond public blockchain network fees, Verus PBaaS Reserve technology enables any organization of any size to make a fractional reserve currency of its own on an independent, uncluttered blockchain with cross-chain interoperability, and immediately useful for payments and conversion to other currencies from within the Verus wallet. 100% of the 0.01% fees for such conversions go directly to the miners and stakers of the organization's new chain, and those miners and stakers also have the option of merge mining up to 14 other blockchains and coins while mining their own project, improving efficiency, profitability, and shared liquidity for everyone involved. Each blockchain is independent and connected through the Verus Reserve protocol
.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST
